title: AWS Fundamentals and Developer Tools Quiz
description: Test your knowledge of AWS infrastructure, CLI, SDKs, and developer tools

questions.question: Alex needs to deploy PetTracker closer to users in Europe. Which component of AWS infrastructure should Alex consider first?
questions.explanation: Regions are the primary way to deploy applications closer to users. Regions are geographic locations containing multiple Availability Zones. For European users, Alex would choose a European region like eu-west-1 (Ireland) or eu-central-1 (Frankfurt).

questions.question: Alex configured AWS CLI with credentials stored in ~/.aws/credentials. Later, Alex sets AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID environment variable. Which credentials will the AWS CLI use?
options: The credentials file always takes priority
The environment variable takes priority over the credentials file
An error will occur due to conflicting credentials
questions.explanation: Environment variables take priority over the credentials file in the AWS credential resolution chain. The order is: command line options > environment variables > credentials file > config file > container credentials > instance profile.

questions.question: PetTracker users in Australia report slow image loading. The images are stored in S3 in us-east-1. What AWS service would best help reduce latency for Australian users?
questions.explanation: CloudFront is a Content Delivery Network (CDN) that caches content at edge locations worldwide. By setting up CloudFront with the S3 bucket as the origin, images will be cached at edge locations close to Australian users, dramatically reducing latency.

questions.question: Alex wants to test Lambda functions locally without deploying to AWS. Which browser-based development environment provides this capability?
options: Neither - local testing requires local installation
questions.explanation: Cloud9 is a full IDE that runs on EC2 and supports local Lambda testing via SAM CLI. CloudShell is a terminal-only environment that doesn't support running local servers or Lambda emulation.

questions.question: Alex's application needs to survive the failure of a single data center. What is the minimum deployment configuration?
options: Single Availability Zone in any region
Multiple Availability Zones within a single region
questions.explanation: Availability Zones are physically separate data centers within a region. Deploying across multiple AZs within a single region provides fault tolerance against single data center failures. Each AZ has independent power, cooling, and networking.

questions.question: Which of the following correctly describes the AWS SDK credential resolution chain order?
options: Config file → Credentials file → Environment variables → Instance profile
Environment variables → Credentials file → Config file → Instance profile
Instance profile → Environment variables → Credentials file → Config file
Code/Constructor → Environment variables → Credentials file → Instance profile
questions.explanation: The SDK credential resolution chain follows this order: Explicitly passed credentials (code/constructor) → Environment variables → Credentials file (~/.aws/credentials) → Config file (~/.aws/config) → Container credentials → Instance profile. Earlier sources take priority.

questions.question: Alex receives a surprise $50 AWS bill and wants to prevent this from happening again. What should Alex do FIRST?
options: Contact AWS Support for a refund
Set up AWS Budgets with alerts
Switch to a smaller instance type
questions.explanation: AWS Budgets allows you to set cost thresholds and receive alerts before charges accumulate. This should be set up BEFORE using any AWS resources to prevent surprise bills. Trusted Advisor helps find optimization opportunities but doesn't provide real-time billing alerts.

questions.question: Alex needs 24/7 phone support for production issues with response time under 1 hour. Which AWS Support plan is required?
questions.explanation: Business Support provides 24/7 phone, email, and chat support with < 1 hour response time for production system down situations. Developer Support only offers business hours support via email with 12-24 hour response time.

questions.question: Which AWS CLI command shows Alex the AWS account and IAM identity currently configured?
questions.explanation: The 'aws sts get-caller-identity' command returns the AWS account, IAM user ARN, and user ID for the credentials being used. This works regardless of whether using IAM user credentials or assumed role credentials.

questions.question: Alex notices that AZ names differ between their AWS account and a colleague's account (Alex's us-east-1a maps to a different physical location than their colleague's us-east-1a). Why is this?
options: This is a bug in AWS
AWS randomizes AZ names per account to distribute load
Different AWS regions have different AZ mappings
Only root accounts get consistent AZ names
questions.explanation: AWS randomizes the mapping of AZ names to physical AZ IDs per account. This prevents all users from choosing 'a' and overloading one physical AZ. To coordinate between accounts, use AZ IDs (like use1-az1) instead of AZ names.
